subject: Re: [junit] Re: Re: How to write a Mock Class for a 3rd party class where the contructor are private
msgSnippet: ... This may be the source of our divergence. I m not sure how much I can help if this is an issue. S.
messageBody:
On 14 October, 2003, Chad Woolley wrote:
> If this were made easy to do, then I can see dynamic/virtual mocks being
> indistinguishable from "real" mocks in terms of functionality. You
> can still use an interface-driven design process, except it would be
> without the interfaces.
>
> I'm still trying to get the concept of interface driven design, so I may
> be off base. Let me know what you think.

This may be the source of our divergence. I'm not sure how much I can help if this is an issue.

S.
